summary:
I am an energetic leader with exceptional business development and marketing skills to help improve cultivate/expand business relationships while improving revenue growth and developing a winning supportive culture among employees. I have worked in the Long-term Care, Contract Therapy and Hospice Care arenas. I also hold an active Nursing Home Administrators license in Ohio.

Specialties: Extremely familiar with long-term care reimbursement systems, managing in-house therapy programs, HR issues, fiscal management and census development. Has developed an invaluable level of resources and knowledge to assist with training modules (clinical, customer service, marketing, financial, operational and reimbursement), implementation of in-house rehabilitation programs, skilled nursing facility clinical and financial analysis and management. With my past sports background, I have also developed team building and leadership training modules.

currentPositions.description: Responsible for oversight of the greater Columbus, Ohio 15 county surrounding area for VITAS Healthcare a national provider of hospice services. In this role we have created a culture of caring and support and have some of the lowest turnover in our organization. I am also active in all our associations participating on the Board of Directors for the Ohio Health Care Association as Vice Chair. I have also been involved on the legislative front in Ohio helping pass HB120 into law testifying on its behalf on several occasions at the state capital. Secured for our Ohio workforce $805,000 dollars of ARPA monies through HB 45. One of two Level V "We honor our Veterans" hospices in the state.
currentPositions.title: General Manager VITAS Healthcare, OHCA Board Directors Hospice

educations.schoolName: Yale University - Yale School of Management

fieldsOfStudy: BS Education English Concentration  and Computer Science

headline: General Manager at VITAS Healthcare

message.text:
Thank You Nursing Home Administrators For What You Do On Your Week of Recognition!

I am proud to say I have been a licensed (still active) Nursing Home Administrator for 35 years! This week is "National Long-Term Care Administrators Week" which kicked off this past Monday and lasts through Friday, a period during which appreciation and special thanks can be given to those running the country’s nursing homes and boy do YOU need it!!!

Our nation’s long-term care leaders have led the way in the battle with the pandemic. The physical and emotional toll that has been placed and undue strain on the profession is unimaginable. 

Each of you have been thrust into an unwanted spotlight and often vilified in the media. Subject to a conflicting and changing regulatory environment, without adequate staffing and with ever-changing directives from local, state, and national agencies! Each and every Nursing Home Administrator who have been on the job throughout it all are owed a debt of gratitude to everyone you have served.

One-week isn't long enough to say "THANK YOU" for everything you have done and will do in the future to care for those we serve!

commentary.text: Great team! Way to represent Y-town Jess!
Congrats Rod I am "Happy" for you!
Congratulations Antone, what an honor! But knowing you, well deserved!
What a great story about a great mentor...thank you for sharing!
